description: Modal dialogs are used in Kirby's Panel in many places for quick actions like adding new pages, changing titles, etc. that don't necessarily need a full new view. You can create your own modals for your fields and other plugins or reuse our existing modals to invoke typical Panel actions.

props.name: icon
props.description: The icon type for the submit button

props.name: size
props.description: The modal size can be adjusted with the size prop

props.name: submitButton
props.description: The text for the submit button

props.name: theme
props.description: The theme of the submit button

props.name: visible
props.description: Dialogs are only openend on demand with the `open()` method. If you need a dialog that's visible on creation, you can set the `visible` prop

events.name: open
events.description: This event is triggered as soon as the dialog opens.

events.name: close
events.description:
This event is triggered when the dialog is being closed. 
This happens independently from the cancel event.

events.name: cancel
events.description:
This event is triggered whenever the cancel button or 
the backdrop is clicked.

events.name: submit
events.description: This event is triggered when the submit button is clicked.

methods.name: open
methods.description: Opens the dialog and triggers the `@open` event

methods.name: close
methods.description: Triggers the `@close` event and closes the dialog.

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Triggers the `@cancel` event and closes the dialog.

methods.name: error
methods.description: Shows the error notification bar in the dialog with the given message

methods.name: success
methods.description: Shows the success notification bar in the dialog with the given message

description: The Autocomplete component can be wrapped around any form of input to get an flexible starting point to provide an real-time autocomplete dropdown. We use it for our `TagsInput` component.

props.name: limit
props.description: Maximum number of displayed results

props.name: skip
props.description: You can pass an array of strings, which should be ignored in the search.

props.name: options
props.description:
Options for the autocomplete dropdown must be passed as an array of 
objects. Each object can have as many items as you like, but a text 
item is required to match agains the query

example.description: [ { text: "this will be searched", id: "anything else is optional" }, ];
example.title: example

props.name: query
props.description: Term to filter options

properties.name: matches
properties.description: all options that match the search query

methods.name: search
methods.description: Opens the dropdown and filters the options

description: The Calendar component is mainly used for our `DateInput` component, but it could be used as stand-alone calendar as well with a little CSS love.

props.name: value
props.description: ISO date string/s, i.e. `2012-12-12`

events.name: input
events.description: The input event is fired when a date is selected.

description: We use the counter in many fields to show the character count of an input or the accepted min/max length of items. You can use the counter yourself very easily:

props.name: calendar
props.description: Deactivate the dropdown calendar or not

props.name: value
props.description: The value for the input should be provided as array. Each value in the array corresponds with the value in the options. If you provide a string, the string will be split by comma.

props.name: autofocus
props.description: If true, the input will be instantly focused when the form is created

props.name: disabled
props.description: If true, the input is disabled and cannot be filled in or edited

props.name: required
props.description: If true, the input must not be empty

events.name: input
events.description: The input event is triggered when the value changes.

events.name: invalid
events.description: The invalid event is triggered when the input validation fails. This can be used to react on errors immediately.

props.name: max
props.description: The last allowed date

props.name: min
props.description: The first allowed date

props.name: value
props.description: The date must be provided as iso date string

props.name: max
props.description: The last allowed date

props.name: min
props.description: The first allowed date

props.name: value
props.description: The date must be provided as iso date string

description: The `k-bar` can be used to create all sorts of toolbars with the option to have three different slots for buttons or other elements: left, center and right.

The box component is a multi-purpose box with text. You can use it as a foundation for empty state displays or anything else that needs to be displayed in a box. It comes with several pre-defined styles …

examples.title: example
examples.content: <k-box text="This is a nice box" theme="positive" />

props.name: theme
props.description: Choose one of the pre-defined styles

props.name: text
props.description: Text to display inside the box

description: The Card component is a very flexible tool to display an image together with a title (text) some meta information (info) and a dropdown with options.

props.name: flag
props.description: An additional button left next to the options toggle, which can be used to define any additional "flag" or option for the card.

props.name: icon
props.description: Defines the card icon instead of an image. If an image is still defined, the image will be used instead of the icon and this setting will be ignored.

props.name: image
props.description: Defines the card image

props.name: info
props.description: Sets the secondary info text

props.name: link
props.description: Sets the link for the entire card

props.name: options
props.description: Defines the options dropdown

props.name: target
props.description: Sets the link target

props.name: text
props.description: Sets the primary card text

events.name: action
events.description: If you've defined the options dropdown, each click on a dropdown item will emmit the `action` event with the option's object's `click` value.

slots.name: options
slots.description: You can overwrite the options button and dropdown with your own elements

description: The Cards component builds a very responsive grid of cards from the given cards option or by injecting cards into the default slot.
The `k-collection` component is a wrapper around `k-cards` and `k-list-items` that makes it easy to switch between the two layouts and adds sortabilty and pagination to the items.

events.name: action
events.description: Emitted on every dropdown action / option

events.name: sort
events.description: Emitted when the sorting has stopped

description: The Column component can be used within a Grid component to layout elements in a very convenient way. The Grid is based on 12 columns by default and each column can change its width with the width property:

props.name: layout
props.description: Available options: `list`|`cards`

description: The Draggable component implements the [Vue.Draggable](https://github.com/SortableJS/Vue.Draggable) library which is a wrapper for the widespread [Sortable.js](https://github.com/RubaXa/Sortable) library.

props.name: current
props.description: Sets the `aria-current` attribute. Especially useful in connection with a `link` attribute.

props.name: disabled
props.description: A disabled button will have no pointer events and the opacity is be reduced.

props.name: icon
props.description: Adds an icon to the button.

props.name: link
props.description: If the link attribute is set, the button will automatically be converted to a proper `a` tag.

props.name: responsive
props.description: A responsive button will hide the button text on smaller screens automatically and only keep the icon. An icon must be set in this case.

props.name: target
props.description: In connection with the `link` attribute, you can also set the target of the link. This does not apply to regular buttons.

props.name: theme
props.description: With the theme you can control the general design of the button.

props.name: tooltip
props.description: The tooltip attribute can be used to add additional text to the button, which is shown on mouseover (with the `title` attribute).

props.name: type
props.description: The type attribute sets the button type like in HTML.

description: The Button Group should always be used when two or more buttons are positioned next to each other. The Button Group takes care of consistent margins between buttons.

Dropdowns always consist of a wrapping `k-dropdown` element and the `k-dropdown-content` element. The wrapper is used for positioning, so the dropdown will open relatively to the button or any other element that serves as the toggle. The dropdown content can contain any number of `k-dropdown-item` elements or any other HTML
